description: Copy a plot to another plot. If the source plot name is not specified, the current plot is assumed. If the destination does not exist, a new plot will be created. Otherwise the existing plot will be overwritten. If a new plot is created, it is made the active plot. Plot settings include the current camera view settings.

keywords.name: s
keywords.description: Source plot name. If not specified, the current plot is assumed.

keywords.name: sDest
keywords.description: Destination plot name. If not specified, a new plot will be created with a default name.

keywords.name: both
keywords.description: Copy both the plot items and the plot settings to the destination. This is the default option.

keywords.name: items
keywords.description: Copy only the list of plot items to the destination.

keywords.name: settings
keywords.description: Copy only the current plot settings to the destination.

examples.description: Copy current plot to a new plot named 'newplot'
Copy only plot items from current plot to 'newplot'
Copy only plot settings from current plot to 'newplot'

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: itasca.command('plot <name> copy <dest> <keyword>') - no direct Python SDK method
